10  package de.funfried.netbeans.plugins.external.formatter.java.eclipse;
11  
12  import javax.swing.text.StyledDocument;
13  
14  import org.junit.Assert;
15  import org.junit.Test;
16  import org.netbeans.junit.NbTestCase;
17  import org.netbeans.modules.editor.NbEditorDocument;
18  
19  /**
20   *
21   * @author bahlef
22   */
23  public class EclipseJavaFormatterServiceTest extends NbTestCase {
24  	public EclipseJavaFormatterServiceTest(String name) {
25  		super(name);
26  	}
27  
28  	/**
29  	 * Test of format method, of class {@link EclipseJavaFormatterService}.
30  	 *
31  	 * @throws Exception if an error occurs
32  	 */
33  	@Test
34  	public void testFormat() throws Exception {
35  		final String text = "package foo;public enum NewEmptyJUnitTest {A,B,C}\n";
36  		final String expected = "package foo;\n" +
37  				"\n" +
38  				"public enum NewEmptyJUnitTest {\n" +
39  				"    A, B, C\n" +
40  				"}\n" +
41  				"";
42  
43  		StyledDocument document = new NbEditorDocument("text/x-java");
44  		document.insertString(0, text, null);
45  
46  		EclipseJavaFormatterService instance = new EclipseJavaFormatterService();
47  		instance.format(document, null);
48  
49  		String actual = document.getText(0, document.getLength());
50  
51  		Assert.assertEquals("Formatting should change the code", expected, actual);
52  	}
53  
54  	/**
55  	 * Test of {@link EclipseJavaFormatterService#format(javax.swing.text.StyledDocument, java.util.SortedSet)}
56  	 * method, of class {@link EclipseJavaFormatterService}.
57  	 *
58  	 * @throws Exception if an error occurs
59  	 */
60  	@Test
61  	public void testUnsupportedFileType() throws Exception {
62  		final String text = "package foo;public enum NewEmptyJUnitTest {A,B,C}\n";
63  
64  		StyledDocument document = new NbEditorDocument("text/xml");
65  		document.insertString(0, text, null);
66  
67  		EclipseJavaFormatterService instance = new EclipseJavaFormatterService();
68  
69  		try {
70  			instance.format(document, null);
71  		} catch (Exception ex) {
72  			Assert.assertTrue("Formatting should not be possible for the given file type", ex.getMessage().contains("The file type 'text/xml' is not supported"));
73  		}
74  	}
75  }
